gov.usgs.cwbquery

Class QueryFilesThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.cwbquery.QueryFilesThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class QueryFilesThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    I was looking at if I cached all of the file names for julian days whether a performance increase in query could be obtained. While I found that it does not take long to look through all of the directories in the old manner (less than 0.1 sec) if the server was doing a lot of queries it is possible this would be a significant amount of time to look through the directories on each query. So in the new QueryServer2 this is used to make it so the files are not taken from the directories when the query server is building a file list with data for certain julian days.

    This thread reads all of the directories every 5 minutes, unless its a new day where it reads them every 15 seconds to pick up new file creations.

    The QueryServer uses this to look for files containing data for the julian day range of a request, it then ensures the files are open using the normal IndexFileReplicator methods.

      • getJulianFiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<QueryFile> getJulianFiles(int julian,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<QueryFile> userFiles)
        return an array list of files for a julian date. QueryServer calls this to get the list of candidate files to open for a given julian day.
        Parameters:
        julian - The julian date to get the list of files for.
        userFiles - If null, a new ArrayList is return, if not null this array list is cleared and the files for the day added and returned.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of QueryFiles or null if there are none on this day
